title: Nirmala By Premchand
description:

It was first serialised in the magazine Chand between November 1925 and November 1926, before being published in its entirety. Written at the beginning of a period where Premchand embarked on writing fiction based on contemporary social issues, Nirmala deals with dowry system in India, using fiction to highlight the need for social reform. Unlike Premchand's other works, Nirmala has a darker tone and ending, and its characters are less idealised. It was translated into English for the first time in 1988.
